intro: Euphrasia arveti, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eyebright, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers with prominent dark markings. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy habitats and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It produces numerous small, tubular flowers that bloom in early summer. Euphrasia arveti is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it thrives in well-drained soil.
